item.description:
Manchester City vs Manchester United LIVE Score, Premier League: Man Utd Stun Man City With Quick Goals, Lead 2-1

Date: Not specified | Source: NDTV

In an exciting Premier League matchup, Manchester United shocked Manchester City by taking an early lead with two quick goals, bringing the score to 2-1.

  • Manchester United scored two goals quickly in the first half.
  • Manchester City is trailing 1-2 at home.
  • The match is crucial for both teams in the title race.

“This is a vital match for both sides, and United is putting on a brilliant performance.”

item.title: ‘Change in foreign policy needed amid changing landscape', says Jaishankar - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Change in foreign policy needed amid changing landscape, says Jaishankar

Publication Date: Sunday, December 15, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar emphasized the need for a revised foreign policy to align with India’s aspirations for a developed nation, or 'Viksit Bharat', during a recent speech.

  • Jaishankar discussed the historical context of India's foreign policy shaped by the 'Nehru development model'.
  • He argued for adapting foreign policy to reflect contemporary global changes and technological advancements.
  • Jaishankar stressed that discussions on foreign policy should not be viewed as political attacks.
  • He called for a more ambitious stance for India on the global stage.
“If today our aspiration at home is to become a Viksit Bharat, surely there must be a foreign policy for Viksit Bharat.” – Subrahmanyam Jaishankar

In conclusion, Jaishankar's remarks highlight the necessity for India to modernize its foreign policy framework to better navigate an evolving international landscape.

item.title: Ex-CIA officer shares chilling theory behind ‘unsettling’ mystery drone sightings - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ex-CIA Officer Shares Chilling Theory Behind Mystery Drone Sightings

Date: Dec 15, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

A former CIA officer, Laura Ballman, shared a chilling theory regarding the recent surge in mystery drone sightings. During a Fox News Live interview, she urged federal authorities to explain the phenomenon, suggesting that these sightings could be part of a covert exercise authorized by the Biden administration.

  • The increase in drone sightings has triggered public concern.
  • Ballman hypothesizes that the sightings may relate to testing evasion or detection technology.
  • Federal officials have downplayed public fears, calling it an “overreaction.”
  • The FBI reported receiving 5,000 tips related to the sightings, with only a small number warranting investigation.
“If I were in a position to advise on this, I would say it’s time to become more transparent,” Ballman stated.

This incident highlights ongoing tensions around transparency and federal disclosure in response to public concern about unidentified aerial phenomena.

item.title: Vishal Mega Mart IPO Allotment Status: Shares finalisation date, time - Check online by PAN, application number - ET Now
item.description:
Vishal Mega Mart IPO Allotment Status: Shares finalisation date, time - Check online by PAN, application number

Date: December 15, 2024 Source: ET Now

The Vishal Mega Mart IPO was open for subscription from December 11 to December 13, 2024, with significant investor interest. The allotment of shares is expected to be finalized by December 16, 2024.

  • The IPO has a total issue size of Rs 8,000 crore and a price range of Rs 74-78 per share.
  • Vishal Mega Mart raised Rs 2,400 crore from anchor investors prior to the offering.
  • The IPO consists entirely of an offer-for-sale from promoter Kedaara Capital-led Samayat Services LLP, with no new equity being issued.

The IPO received 80.75 times subscription from Qualified Institutional Buyers, 14.25 times from non-institutional investors, and 2.31 times from Retail Individual Investors.

The IPO must be watched closely as its listing date on BSE and NSE is set for December 18, 2024, marking an important milestone for the company's public market entry.

item.title: MobiKwik IPO: Know Latest GMP, Allotment, and Listing Dates - News18
item.description:
MobiKwik IPO: Know Latest GMP, Allotment, and Listing Dates

Last Updated: December 15, 2024, 16:35 IST

The much-anticipated initial public offering (IPO) of One MobiKwik Systems Ltd has concluded with impressive subscription numbers. With an allotment finalisation date of Monday, December 16, and the listing scheduled for Wednesday, December 18, here’s all you need to know.

  • MobiKwik's unlisted shares are trading at Rs 444 per share, which is Rs 165 or 59.14% higher than the upper price band of Rs 279.
  • The IPO was open for bidding from December 11 to December 13 and received a 125.69 times subscription.
  • The retail investor category subscribed 141.78 times, while non-institutional investors subscribed 114.7 times.
  • The Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIB) category had a subscription rate of 125.82 times.
  • The IPO allotment process will be finalised on December 16, with shares debuting on December 18.
  • The issue size consists entirely of fresh equity shares worth Rs 572 crore.
The MobiKwik IPO has garnered significant attention from market participants, signaling a strong debut.

Stay tuned for the listing on December 18 as MobiKwik makes its mark in the public market space.

item.title: ‘If Pranab Mukherjee was made PM, Manmohan Singh as President in 2012…’: Mani Shankar Aiyar in tell-all book - Hindustan Times
item.description:
‘If Pranab Mukherjee was made PM, Manmohan Singh as President in 2012…’: Mani Shankar Aiyar in tell-all book

Date: Dec 15, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

In his book ‘A Maverick in Politics’, senior Congress leader Mani Shankar Aiyar reflects on the state of governance during the UPA-II government, emphasizing the need for a strong leader in 2012.

  • Aiyar believes Pranab Mukherjee should have been made PM, while Manmohan Singh should have assumed the presidency.
  • He attributes governance failures during the UPA-II tenure to the health issues of Singh and Congress president Sonia Gandhi.
  • The handling of several crises, especially the 'India Against Corruption' movement, is criticized for being ineffective.
  • Aiyar suggests that Mukherjee's assumed leftist leanings could have concerned the business community.
“If this obvious step had been taken, we would not have gone into a paralysis of governance and thus opened the door to the worst excesses of Hindutva in the general elections of 2014.”

Aiyar’s analysis provides a poignant look at missed opportunities in Indian politics and governance during a critical period.

item.title: Life-changing day: Dharavi’s Simran Shaikh, daughter of a wireman, fetches Rs 1.90 crore bid at WPL auction - The Indian Express
item.description:
Dharavi’s Simran Shaikh Becomes Most Expensive Player at WPL Auction

Publication Date: [Insert Date] | Source: The Indian Express

Simran Shaikh, a resident of Dharavi, has made headlines after being bought by Gujarat Giants for Rs 1.90 crore at the Women’s Premier League auction in Bengaluru, marking a significant milestone in her cricket career.

  • Simran overcame societal pressures and discouragement to pursue cricket.
  • She expressed her gratitude towards her father for supporting her aspirations despite challenges.
  • Her price at the auction places her as the second-highest paid uncapped player in WPL history.
  • Simran aims to uplift her family’s living conditions with her earnings.
  • She hopes her success will inspire other cricketers from Dharavi.
“Today the same people have come to congratulate our family,” - Simran Shaikh

This remarkable achievement not only showcases Simran's talent but also highlights the potential of sports to change lives, especially in underprivileged communities.

item.title: 'When You Get 100 MPs, You Celebrate...' Omar Abdullah Slams Congress Over EVM Charge - News18
item.description:
When You Get 100 MPs, You Celebrate... Omar Abdullah Slams Congress Over EVM Charge

Date: December 15, 2024 Source: News18

Omar Abdullah has criticized the Congress party for questioning the reliability of Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) after its electoral losses, arguing that parties should not blame the voting mechanism when election results are unfavorable.

  • Abdullah rebuffed Congress’s doubts about EVMs, emphasizing they can't question results only after losses.
  • He highlighted the need for consistency regarding trust in electoral mechanisms.
  • The Congress has called for a return to paper ballots following poor performance in recent state elections.
  • Abdullah drew on personal experience, stating he has faced defeat without blaming election systems.
“When you get a hundred plus members of Parliament using the same EVMs, and you celebrate that as sort of a victory for your party, you can’t then a few months later turn around and say… we don’t like these EVMs because now the election results aren’t going the way we would like them to.”

In conclusion, Abdullah’s remarks reinforce the stance that political parties must own their electoral outcomes without shifting blame to the voting systems.

item.title: Travis Head reveals secret behind tackling India pacer Jasprit Bumrah: ‘More about being proactive with my…’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Travis Head Reveals Tactics Against Jasprit Bumrah in Border-Gavaskar Trophy

Date: Dec 15, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Travis Head shone in the third Border-Gavaskar Trophy Test against India, revealing his proactive approach to tackle pacer Jasprit Bumrah.

  • Head scored 152 runs off 160 balls, marking his second consecutive century in the series.
  • He built a crucial 241-run partnership with Steve Smith for the fourth wicket.
  • Head emphasized the importance of being proactive rather than reactive against Bumrah's bowling.
  • Bumrah took five wickets, including Head and Smith, stabilizing India's bowling attack.
“He (Jasprit Bumrah) goes for the base of the stumps early. But I think it's about reacting... more about being proactive with my forward defense.” - Travis Head

Head's performance continues to boost Australia's chances for the WTC Final, showcasing a solid team portrayal ahead of future matches.

item.title: Mumbai vs Madhya Pradesh LIVE Cricket Score, SMAT 2024 Final: Shedge wins it for MUM as they claim their second SMAT title - The Indian Express
item.description:
Mumbai vs Madhya Pradesh Highlights, SMAT 2024 Final: Shedge wins it for MUM as they claim second title

Date: December 14, 2024 Source: Indian Express

Mumbai's star-studded batting lineup successfully chased down a target of 175 runs set by Madhya Pradesh, winning the SMAT 2024 final.

  • Rajat Patidar scored an unbeaten 81 runs for Madhya Pradesh, helping them post a competitive total.
  • Mumbai, opting to field first, restricted MP to 175 runs in 20 overs.
  • Suryansh Shedge played a pivotal role by scoring a quick 36 runs off just 15 balls, leading Mumbai to victory in 18 overs.
  • Suryakumar Yadav contributed 48 runs, maintaining control over the innings.
  • This match marked Mumbai's second title in the tournament’s history.
“Despite batting at No 3 for RCB in the past, Rajat Patidar has been batting at No 5 for Madhya Pradesh.”

This thrilling final showcased Mumbai’s dominance in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy, further solidifying their status in Indian cricket.

item.title: ITC Foods targets growth in north and west India amid shift to branded products | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
ITC Foods Targets Growth in North and West India Amid Shift to Branded Products

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Company Business News

ITC Ltd is set to expand its food brands and explore premium market opportunities as more consumers in India's poorer regions begin to seek branded products.

  • ITC Ltd aims to scale its existing food brands and enter the premium segment.
  • Growing consumer class in regions like Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, and Rajasthan is increasing demand for branded foods.
  • The company is considering acquisitions to strengthen its brand portfolio.
“As more consumers enter the consuming class, we expect demand for branded products to grow significantly.” - Senior Company Official

This strategic focus on brand growth comes in light of shifting consumer preferences toward packaged and branded food products in underserved regions.

item.title: 5 Majestic Pictures Of Space Captured By NASA - Times Now
item.description:
5 Majestic Pictures Of Space Captured By NASA

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 | Source: Times Now Digital

This article showcases five stunning images of space captured by NASA’s advanced telescopes, highlighting various celestial phenomena.

  • NGC 3603: A brilliant cluster of young stars resembling a fireworks display.
  • Eta Carinae: A massive star on the verge of a supernova explosion.
  • Helix Nebula: A breathtaking view combining detailed and expansive perspectives.
  • Starburst Galaxy NGC 1569: An extraordinary starburst galaxy producing stars at an accelerated rate.
  • Carina Nebula: A view revealing hidden stellar nurseries and vibrant regions of star formation.
“Together, they create a seamless and breathtaking view of the Helix Nebula.”

This collection reveals the beauty and complexity of the universe, demonstrating NASA's capabilities in astrophotography.

item.title: Maharashtra cabinet expansion: Ajit Pawar's message to NCP legislators not getting ministerial berths - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ajit Pawar Addresses NCP Legislators on Ministerial Berths Following Maharashtra Cabinet Expansion

Date: Dec 15, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Maharashtra deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar assured legislators without ministerial positions that they will have opportunities during this government's tenure, following the cabinet expansion where 39 ministers were sworn in, increasing the cabinet's size to 42.

  • 39 ministers were appointed in the latest cabinet expansion in Nagpur.
  • BJP received 19 ministerial positions, Shiv Sena 11, and NCP 9.
  • Ajit Pawar indicated that more opportunities for becoming ministers will be available over the next two-and-a-half years.
  • Despite many deserving candidates, ministerial berths are limited.
  • This cabinet expansion follows the Mahayuti alliance's significant victory in the November 20 polls, securing 230 out of 288 seats.
“Everybody wants to become a minister and deserves an opportunity, but the ministerial berths are limited,” said Ajit Pawar.

In conclusion, the cabinet expansion reflects the government's efforts to make room for more representation while addressing the aspirations of their legislators in Maharashtra.

item.title: Abhishek Manu Singhvi: ‘One Nation, One Election will face serious Constitutional challenges … it violates the Basic Structure’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
Abhishek Manu Singhvi: ‘One Nation, One Election will face serious Constitutional challenges … it violates the Basic Structure’

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: The Indian Express

The Centre is planning to introduce Bills for 'One Nation, One Election' in Parliament amid opposition concerns. Senior Congress leader Abhishek Manu Singhvi expresses legal and democratic objections to the proposed simultaneous elections.

  • Singhvi argues that the plan undermines the democratic mandate and could lead to constitutional challenges.
  • He describes the concept as appealing but fundamentally flawed due to its imposition on the will of the people.
  • Reports suggest potential legal ramifications that could violate the Basic Structure of the Indian Constitution.
  • The Congress and many regional parties oppose the proposal, emphasizing the need for maintaining federalism.
  • Concerns are raised regarding the practicality of synchronizing elections and the alleged financial benefits claimed by the government.
“Democracy is a festival of diversity, uncertainty, spontaneous will.”

In conclusion, Singhvi believes that while the initiative aims for uniformity, it risks undermining the essence of democracy in India.

item.title: Zakir Hussain hospitalised in the US due to ‘serious ailments’, family seeks prayers for recovery - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Zakir Hussain Hospitalised in the US, Family Requests Prayers for Recovery

Published on: Dec 15, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Tabla maestro Zakir Hussain has been hospitalised in San Francisco after experiencing heart-related health problems. His family seeks prayers for his speedy recovery.

  • Zakir Hussain was admitted to the ICU with serious health ailments.
  • He has been suffering from blood pressure issues leading to his hospitalization.
  • The family is asking for blessings and prayers for his recovery.
  • Zakir, at 73, is a renowned tabla player with multiple accolades.
“He is unwell and admitted in the ICU right now. We all are worried about the situation.” - Rakesh Chaurasia

The situation remains concerning for his family and fans as they await more updates on his health.

item.title: Tabla Maestro Zakir Hussain In ICU In US Over Heart Ailment - NDTV
item.description:
Zakir Hussain Admitted to ICU in San Francisco for Heart Issues

Date: December 15, 2024

Source: NDTV

Tabla maestro Zakir Hussain has been admitted to the ICU of a San Francisco hospital due to heart-related problems. His condition has raised concerns among friends and fans.

  • Zakir Hussain, aged 73, is facing health issues related to his heart.
  • He has been in the ICU for a week, according to his friend Rakesh Chaurasia.
  • Chaurasia expressed worry about Hussain's situation, highlighting the seriousness of his condition.
“We all are worried about the situation,” said Zakir Hussain's friend.

The music community is hopeful for his recovery and is anxiously awaiting updates on his health status.
